text: The Stevens-Buchanan House is a historic mansion in Brandon, Mississippi, U.S.. It was built in 1868 for James Richardson Stevens and his wife, Martha L. Patton. It was designed in the Greek Revival and Italianate architectural styles. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since May 5, 1978. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Mississippi Category:Greek Revival architecture in Mississippi Category:Italianate architecture in Mississippi Category:Houses completed in 1869 Category:National Register of Historic Places in Rankin County, Mississippi
title: Stevens-Buchanan House
